summary: Both REQ-9 (backend case-insensitive username uniqueness check with normalization) and REQ-10 (frontend username trimming and lowercasing before submission) are implemented in the diff. The backend introduces a usernameMap for O(1) lookups, normalizes usernames to lowercase on registration, and a migration module handles existing users. The frontend normalizes usernames in both useQueries.ts and SignupPage.tsx, validates non-empty after trimming, and preserves error messages for truly taken usernames.

hallucinated_features.description: A data migration module (backend/migration.mo) was added to backfill a usernameMap from existing userAccounts for already-registered users.
hallucinated_features.reason: The build request does not explicitly request a migration module or a usernameMap index structure. This goes beyond what was explicitly requested, though it supports the backward-compatibility constraint.

hallucinated_features.description: Username normalization (trim and lowercase) was also applied to the authenticateUser mutation in useQueries.ts, not just the registerUser mutation.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-10 only specifies normalizing the username during signup/registration. The non-goals explicitly state not to change authentication logic. Normalizing on login/authenticate was not requested.
